remarks: Combine two sums into a single sum over the cartesian product. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Apr-2014.)
statement:
fsumxp.1 $e |- ( z = <. j , k >. -> D = C ) $.
fsumxp.2 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fsumxp.3 $e |- ( ph -> B e. Fin ) $.
fsumxp.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( j e. A /\ k e. B ) ) -> C e. CC ) $.
fsumxp $p |- ( ph -> sum_ j e. A sum_ k e. B C = sum_ z e. ( A X. B ) D ) $.
$d A j k z $.
$d B j k z $.
$d C z $.
$d D j k $.
$d j k ph z $.
